review_text: Leaping Deer Ranch was the perfect location for our small outdoor wedding! Due to COVID-19, we needed to keep our wedding small, and the ranch was the perfect size to accommodate ourselves and our 9 guests. The ranch is spacious and well decorated, which made the perfect backdrop for our reception; the large dining room table was even able to comfortably seat the 11 of us! The location of the ranch is about 1.5-2 hours from an airport, depending on if you fly into Santa Fe or Albuquerque, so our guests rented cars and there was ample parking at the ranch. The ranch is also located ~15 minutes from Las Vegas, NM, which was incredibly convenient for getting groceries. We ordered our reception dinner from The Skillet in Las Vegas, which is a restaurant/bar that also hosts karaoke Thursday nights at 9; the food was delicious and karaoke was a blast! Leaping Deer is also just a great place for hanging out and relaxing. We spent a lot of time in the hot tub, gazing at the stars - we even saw shooting stars! The land itself is stunning and has spectacular views, especially when you hike up the hillside with Fluffy the adorable resident malamute. Our first night there we were also treated to a giant double rainbow right out in front of the ranch! There were a few hiccups here and there, such as the refrigerator in the kitchen being broken, so we relied on a smaller one that was kindly setup for us on the porch. Also, one of our guests found a scorpion in their room, so be careful to always shut doors behind you and don't open windows without screens. All in all, we had a wonderful stay and we're very grateful to Colin and the crew for such a pleasant time!

Take your coffee or tea outside and watch the sun and the clouds play hide-and-seek with Hermit Peak, the background for the sweet smelling grass pasture that extends from the back door of this cabin. With 150 acres of pines, oaks, cottonwoods and grasslands to walk in you have plenty of space to enjoy the wildlife. For the hiker numerous trails are nearby in the National Forests, and for the fishing buffs, the streams are some well kept local jewels. Las Vegas is a neat town to visit, the art community is up and coming and the restaurants serve some famous green hatch chili dishes. Visit the plaza in the historical district with it's famous 1880's hotels and buildings for a walk in yesteryear. Easy day trips to Santa Fe, Pecos , Mora and Taos are scenic drives not to be missed. Whether you enjoy the outdoors or the Old West appeal of the local towns, this cabin is far in the woods but easy enough to get too. Enjoy, I sure did and will again.
